questions.label: ICEBREAKER
prompts: What is the best TV show/movie that you watched recently?
UC Socially Dead; Agree or disagree?
What is your favorite holiday?
Star Wars or Avengers?
What brought you to San Diego?
Who is your favorite singer/band?
What has been your most memorable vacation?
What is your favorite thing to do at the beach?
What has been your favorite class so far?
What other languages do you speak? Teach everyone to say “hello” in that language.
If you were to become a YouTuber, what would your topic be (e.g., vlogger, gamer, etc.)?
What is an item on your bucket list?
If you had to become a teacher, what subject would you teach?
Are you a dog person or a cat person?
What did you do this past Summer?
How is your course load this quarter?
Who is the funniest person in your family?
How do you spend your weekends?

questions.label: IDEATION
prompts: What are your key values?
Who do you think is a better CEO for Apple, Tim Cook or Steve Jobs?
Who is a leader who inspires you? Why?
What’s your strongest leadership style? Which one do you want to work on?
Who do you need to network with?
Who is your role model?
What takes you out of your comfort zone?
What can you learn from entrepreneurs like Sarah Blakely (Spanx) and Tony Hsieh (Zappos)?
If you ran a company, what kind of culture would you want to build?
What’s your strongest leadership style? Which one do you want to work on?
What can you learn from entrepreneurs like Sarah Blakely (Spanx) and Tony Hsieh (Zappos)?

questions.label: TEAM QUESTION
prompts: What do you believe is the most important factor for a successful team?
What do you hope to get out of this class?
Based on previous team projects, what do you think worked and didn’t work for you?
What do you look for in a good team member?
How can you help create psychological safety in your team?
Ideally, how often would you like to meet with your team members?
What helps you to feel psychologically safe in a team?
How do you deal with conflicts in the team?
Do you like to study on-campus or off-campus?
What is your main mode of communication for your project (e.g. email, Facebook)?
Describe your management experience (e.g., student club or project leader)?
What is your biggest pet peeve in group projects?
What are your strengths and weaknesses in group projects?
What is a project that you have completed that you are proud of?
Do you like to work in the morning, afternoon, or evening?
How do you decide to split the work among team members?
What is the most important thing you personally need to do when you’re in a team?
Do you prefer working in small groups or large groups?
